description.narrative: Den föreslagna åtgärder kommer att göra det möjligt för projektet att få nödvändig teknisk hjälp genom en Världsbanken Externally Funded Output (EFO) mekanism. Det kommer också att möjliggöra en Efficient Securities Markets Institutional Development(ESMID) för att ge sin teknisk input i utvecklingen av en regional obligationsmarknad för EAC regionen.

The proposed intervention will enable the project to obtain the requisite technical assistance through a World Bank Externally Funded Output (EFO) mechanism. It will also enable the Efficient Securities Markets Institutional Development (ESMID) to provide their technical input in the development of a regional bond market for the EAC region.

description.narrative: The EAC Capital Markets Development Program has focused on the development of a regional bond market in the region (country focus on Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania Rwanda and Burundi) and was established as part of the broader ESMID program (also receiving Swedish support, ref. 71001804). ESMID has been supporting the development of an enabling environment for improving access to long-term local currancy financing for economic development. ESMID was laying the foundation for reform and integration of EAC capital markets by improving the enabling environment for issuance, trading and investing in long-term local currancy bonds. As a result, existing laws and regulations governing primary and secondary bond markets were reformed in the EAC. The overall program objectives of the EAC project (intended to leverage ESMID´s goveranance and management structure, relationships with stakeholders, on the ground presence and momentum/achievements of ongoing projects) has been (i) to foster the development of well-functioning securities markets in Africa and (ii) to improve ability fo finance infrastructure and housing development through bond markets. Support to ESMID EAC program was decided in line with the Swedish Regional Strategy for Sub-Saharan Africa 2010-2015 and the program has made an important contribution in advancing the process in regional integration of bond markets in EAC through bringing together key organizations to develop well-crafted action and implementation plans on both a national and regional basis such as the common strategy and roadmap for developing government bond markets. Compared with the original set results indicators, the program has been able to achieve targets across all components. Main outcome achievements are (i) the legal and regulatory frameworks for issuance and trading of bonds including new instruments have been reformed, example: new code of corporate goverance for public issuers of securites in Kenya has been enacted; (ii) modernized bond market and improved liquidity and transparency, example: Kenya is following recommendations on adopting an Electronic Trading Platform and an e-bond module for trading Governement debt securities is at an advanced stage of implementation; (iii) EAC governement bond markets have been more aligned with the regional vision for bond markets, example: the strategy and roadmap for developing government bond markets in EAC has been formally adopted by the EAC Monetary and Affairs Committee; (iv) increased knowledge and skills among key stakeholders, leading to staff being more comfortable, example: 90% of participants in capacity building events reported increased knowledge; (v) increased issuance of bonds due to transaction support, example: ESMID directly supported bond issuance worth USD 51 million by NMB Bank in Tanzania and IFC local currency issuance in Rwanda. The level of new non-government bond issuance since program inception grew sevenfold to US$712 million across East Africa against a target of US$150 million as at December 2017. Of this, 7% - US$51 million - benefited from ESMID's direct involvement with three bond issues i.e. IFC local currency issuance in Rwanda and two tranches of NMB Bank's issuance in Tanzania.The enabling environment reforms including legal and regulatory reforms on primary market issuance and secondary market trading as a result of ESMID's interventions indirectly contributed to increased bond issuance across East Africa by addressing important regulatory and market structure constraints. For example, the time taken to issue non-government bonds improved from an EAC average of 270 days to 30 days in Kenya and 60 days in Tanzania.
